title.narrative: REACH: Response to the Unmet Humanitarian Needs of the Most Vulnerable Populations in Mindanao and the Visayas Affected by Conflict, Disasters and the COVID-19 pandemic

description.narrative:
This is a three-month intervention approved by ECHO that was added as a modification from a previous proposal sent to ECHO last June 24, 2021. The modification is being effected through MR3 which outlines the rationale and the cover humanitarian response actions that are being proposed to respond to needs that have recently emerged in the aftermath of Typhoon Rai (locally known as Odette). This is now reflected as Result 7 of this Action and is composed of four key activities pertaining to provision of the following services: WASH, food assistance, shelter NFIs, and emergency health.
MR 3 (TY Rai): About 57,750 individuals from municipalities severely affected by TY Odette will be reached by humanitarian actions across the sectors of WASH, FSL, Shelter and Emergency Health. Priority will be given to families that have endured severe losses as a result of total or significant damages to homes and livelihoods and who will likely experience prolonged displacements.
Overall Principal Objective: To contribute to addressing the unmet humanitarian needs and reducing suffering of the most vulnerable, at-risk and underserved populations in Mindanao and other areas in the Philippines affected by conflict, natural hazards and COVID 19 pandemic
Result 7: Access to humanitarian aid provided to families and communities affected by Typhoon Rai (Odette)
The REACH project is a consortium lead by AAH, together with ACF, CARE, Oxfam GB, Save the Children and Plan International.
